text:
I am trying to run julia in a zsh inside emacs - if I type “]” I get
```julia> ]
]
ERROR: syntax: unexpected "]"
Stacktrace:
 [1] top-level scope at none:1```
How do I persuade julia to enter package(?) mode?

elements.text: I am trying to run julia in a zsh inside emacs - if I type “]” I get

julia> ]
]
ERROR: syntax: unexpected "]"
Stacktrace:

How do I persuade julia to enter package(?) mode?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56410| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Maybe you are using an ancient Julia version?

elements.text: Maybe you are using an ancient Julia version?

text:
I replied in general-bridged, but one workaround is to do
```using Pkg
pkg"status"```

elements.text: I replied in general-bridged, but one workaround is to do

using Pkg
pkg"status"

text: I was using gitter and I didn’t realise there was a slack channel for julia

elements.text: I was using gitter and I didn’t realise there was a slack channel for julia

text: terminal inside emacs is dumb, not sure if that affects REPL modes

text: if I remember correctly, <https://github.com/tpapp/julia-repl> uses a more capable terminal.  but you may want to head to <#C9YGT3NG4|emacs> for alternative workflows in Emacs
